title: RP161: Improving farm practices in Belmunda North Queensland

tasks.task: Maintain and manage a cane farm through a soil nutrient management project.
subtasks: Engage with a maps officer and pharmacists for project suggestions.
Implement techniques like controlled traffic and minimum tillage.
Analyze soil tests and create fertiliser recommendations for each block.
Attend seminars and workshops on soil science and nutrient uptake.
Utilize Google Earth for farm management, adding data layers like yield maps and soil samples.
Install soil moisture sensors (G dots) to monitor irrigation needs.
Collaborate with a pharmacist for unbiased nutrient management advice.
Address the property's features, including irrigation, proximity to the sea, and generational history.
Validate recommendations with soil science experts and maintain farm management practices.

tasks.task: Participate in the BMP (Best Management Practices) project to enhance farm sustainability.
subtasks: Provide consent for soil and EC mapping.
Receive and utilize GPS dots for better soil moisture monitoring.
Attend Google Earth training sessions and integrate farm data onto USB drives.
Follow the project's progress and gain confidence in the farm's management practices.
Partner with the project for confidence in resisting external scrutiny.
